item.title: Operation
item.description:
How Time-of-Flight (ToF) Detection Works

Laser-Based Distance Measurement

Thingsee COUNT uses Time-of-Flight (ToF) laser technology to detect people moving through doorways.

Detection principle:

  1. Laser emission: Sensor emits infrared laser pulses downward
  2. Reflection: Laser bounces off objects (people, floor) beneath sensor
  3. Time measurement: Sensor measures time for laser to return
  4. Distance calculation: Time-of-flight converted to distance (height of object)
  5. Object detection: Changes in distance indicate person passing through
  6. Direction determination: Sequence of distance changes determines entry vs. exit

item.title: Configuration
item.description:
Configuration Overview

Thingsee COUNT configuration is performed using the Thingsee Toolbox mobile app (iOS/Android). The primary configuration is entry direction (IN vs. OUT), which determines how the sensor interprets people passing through the doorway.

Configuration method:

  • Scan QR code on sensor with Thingsee Toolbox app
  • Select IN or OUT based on sensor placement
  • Settings applied immediately to sensor

No remote configuration:

  • Unlike some Haltian sensors (RADAR, ENTRYWAY with remote config), Thingsee COUNT requires local configuration via Toolbox app
  • Must be physically present with smartphone/tablet to configure

item.title: Specifications
item.description:
Product Overview

Thingsee COUNT is a USB-powered people counting sensor using Time-of-Flight (ToF) laser technology for directional counting in doorways and passageways.

Primary features:

  • Time-of-Flight (ToF) laser distance measurement
  • Directional people counting (entries and exits)
  • USB 5V powered (continuous power required, no battery)
  • Wirepas Mesh network connectivity
  • Maximum 1000mm passageway width
  • Indoor use, cradle mounting system

Detection Technology

Time-of-Flight (ToF) Sensor

Technology:

  • Type: ToF laser distance measurement
  • Laser class: Class 1 laser (eye-safe under normal use)
  • Wavelength: Infrared (IR) laser (typically 850-940nm, invisible to human eye)
  • Detection principle: Measures time for laser pulse to reflect off objects (people, floor)
  • Distance accuracy: ±1-5% typical (millimeter precision)
  • Detection range: 0-2100mm vertical (floor to ceiling)

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description:
Quick Diagnostics

Sensor Health Checklist

Before detailed troubleshooting, verify these basics:

✅ Power:

  • USB cable connected to sensor cradle
  • USB power adapter plugged into active outlet
  • Outlet not controlled by light switch (check switch positions)
  • Power adapter LED lit (if equipped with indicator)

✅ Installation:

  • Sensor securely attached to cradle (springs facing upward, snap sound heard)
  • Cradle firmly mounted (tape adhesion good, or screws tight)
  • ToF sensor lens clean (no dust, dirt, or condensation)
  • Passageway width ≤ 1000mm
  • Sensor centered above passageway
